kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
The item manager APIs require being constructed via a factory where you supply the current user ID.
In your case you should be injecting `IHeadlessItemManagerFactory` and use it to create a new `IHeadlessItemManager`.
Note that `IHeadlessItemManagerFactory` and `IHeadlessItemManager` are in an `.Internal` namespace, which means even though they are `public` we can make breaking changes to them at any time.
If you would like to see improved support for programmatic management of headless channels, [give us some feedback on our roadmap](https://roadmap.kentico.com/tabs/5-released).
